CHIMNEY MAINTENANCE

From the Chimney Safety Institute of America (CSIA):


JoAnne Calderone, executive director recommends that you have your chimney checked every year. "Whether your house is old or new, an annual chimney inspection by a professional chimney sweep can ensure that both your chimney system and venting system are working properly and safely."

Burn only well-seasoned hardwoods to reduce creosote buildup.

Install a carbon monoxide detector to warn if harmful gases are entering your home.

Have your chimney waterproofed to prevent long-term corrosion and masonry damage.

Inspect and maintain your chimney flashing and caulking of cornerboards and trim making up the chase and nearby roof system.

If you own, or are planning to install, a high-efficiency gas furnace, always open the "fresh air" vent that is provided as required by most mechanical type fireplace manufacturers and local building codes.
See also: Fireplace
Fresh air ventilation
http://www.csia.org/
